chapter.title: Cleaning the Nix Store
chapter.para: Nix has a purely functional model, meaning that packages are never upgraded in place. Instead new versions of packages end up in a different location in the Nix store (/nix/store). You should periodically run Nix’s garbage collector to remove old, unreferenced packages. This is easy:

Note that NixOS system configurations are stored in the profile /nix/var/nix/profiles/system.

Another way to reclaim disk space (often as much as 40% of the size of the Nix store) is to run Nix’s store optimiser, which seeks out identical files in the store and replaces them with hard links to a single copy.
Since this command needs to read the entire Nix store, it can take quite a while to finish.

section.title: NixOS Boot Entries
section.para: If your /boot partition runs out of space, after clearing old profiles you must rebuild your system with nixos-rebuild boot or nixos-rebuild switch to update the /boot partition and clear space.
